alert.note: Alert for Macon (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 9:25AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Macon. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. A couple of low water crossing along the Nantahala river may be inundated between the Rainbow Springs community and Nantahala Lake. These include Tate Cove Rd, Water Gauge Rd, and Rainbow Springs Rd. Moderate to heavy rain is expected to continue off and on through tonight, likely resulting in prolonged minor flooding of these areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain showers continuing over the area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen overnight and this is resulting in elevated stream flows and rising levels on the Nantahala River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
